pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:5.1: 24. The second training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their upper robes covering their heads. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:7.2: “‘I will not sit with my head covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not cover the head.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with his upper robe covering his head, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:10.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
